Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. The movie is divided into two parts: the beginning consists of an adult Miyazawa who, in the style of Grimm Brothers fairy tales, recounts childhood stories through which he reflects on the harshness of life. The second half dramatizes these tales, with Miyazawa tacked in as a supporting character.<|end_of_text|>

This movie is nothing short of a dark, gritty masterpiece. I may be bias, as the Apartheid era is an area I've always felt for South Africa. The problems they have are immense, and only solutions of varying degree are contemplated and implemented. The truth is, many other countries are overpopulated to the point of unbearable strife. Are those people not made by someone to live with on the same small planet? Isn't that just another form of apartheid?
